Row.Text: Increases the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, [ICON_PEACE] Faith, and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of a city. Only the Shoshone may build it.

The Totem Pole is the Shoshone unique replacement for the Monument. In addition to the normal [ICON_CULTURE] output, the Totem Pole also yields a small amount of [ICON_PEACE] Faith and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.

A totem is a spirit being, sacred object, or symbol that serves as an emblem of a group of people, such as a family, clan, lineage, or tribe. Totem poles are monumental carvings, consisting of poles, posts, or pillars, which are carved with symbols or figures. They are usually made from large trees, by indigenous peoples of the Pacific Northwest coast of North America (Washington, Oregon, and Canada's western province, British Columbia). The word totem derives from the Algonquian (most likely Ojibwe) word odoodem, meaning "his kinship group".[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Shoshone originated from the Great Basin region of the western United States, but conflict with other native groups and with white settlers would push them further west over time. Contact with tribes of the Pacific region was common, as was trade in both goods and culture. Several Algonquian tribes, including the Blackfoot and Cheyenne, had regular contact with the Shoshone.
